events.name: GDG STL Kickoff, Android Dev Summit Recap

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
We're kicking off the reboot of the GDG STL group with an Android evening.  Ben Oberkfell, a mobile developer with American Express, will present a recap of the Google Android Developers Summit taking place in November.  We'll also talk about things you'll want to care about as an Android developer in 2016.

We're also looking to get an idea of what people are interested in, for event planning and talk scheduling purposes.  Come on out and speak your mind!  We also have future events on the drawing table covering the Google Cloud Platform and Angular.
events.how_to_find_us: In the Central West End, at Euclid & Washington.

events.name: Learn Cloud Computing with Google Cloud!

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Come and learn Cloud Computing. We will teach you how to do the following things in Cloud: 

• Spin up instances and auto-scaling instance groups

• Run a website with a front-end load balancer and multiple webheads

• Create, mount, format and snapshot disks

• Create a Docker container cluster and run your app in Docker environment

• Automate your infrastructure

• Monitor your infrastructure, containers, apps, logs all from one place

Free Pizza and Drinks

6:30 - 7:00 Networking time

7:00 - 8:00 Tech talk

events.name: Learn Cloud Computing Part II from Google Cloud experts

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Zach Jordan and his team of technical experts from Google will be presenting Google Cloud. Here is an overview of the talk. Google Cloud Platform offers a full range of infrastructure options across the compute spectrum, from managed container-based services to virtual machines and more. In addition, it's also a place to manage the entire lifecycle of your data-centric workloads. In this talk, we'll give an overview of the different compute, storage, and data services that are available from Google Cloud Platform. We'll discuss everything from object storage to big data to data warehouse, and everything in between.

6:30 - 7:00: Pizza and Networking time
7:00 - 8:00: Tech talk time

events.name: Android & RxJava with Jason Riley

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
What:

Asynchrony's Jason Riley will give us a presentation on RxJava, a way to implement reactive programming within your Android projects. 

Doors open at 6pm, program at 6:30.

Who:

Jason's been an Android developer for the last five years, and has been at Asynchrony for the last four.

[masked]
github jriley
twitter @jasonriley

Where:

Asynchrony, across from the ballpark.

MetroLink: The closest metro stop is Stadium Station. When you exit the station, walk down Spruce Street and we are located on the left side about 1 block down. 

Parking: You can park at the visitor spots off 9th Street or the Cupples garage at 10th & Spruce. (421 S. 10th) The garage parking is $2 per hour (cash only).  I am also told the parking behind the Cupples building is free after 6pm.
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the 6th floor, someone will be in the lobby to bring us up.

events.name: Let's talk Firebase!

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Doors at 6PM, talk at 6:30. Thanks to Bonfyre for hosting!  Pizza and drinks will be on hand courtesy of American Express.

At Google I/O 2016, we saw some cool announcements about Firebase -- including a big rollup of lots of other mobile/web APIs now under one cohesive umbrella.

Let's explore what's new through some demos!

Things we'll probably check out include the Firebase realtime database, push notifications, remote configuration, and the Cloud Test Lab that allows you to test Android apps on real devices in Google's data center.
events.how_to_find_us: Shaw and Edwards on the Hill, same building as Modesto Tapas.

events.name: Android Pro Lightning Talks

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
At our last meeting we came up with the idea of sharing little quick tips for making our workflows and jobs easier. Let's do this!

Come with a slide or two (or zero) and share tips that makes your job go easier.
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be in Asynchrony's Forest Park conference room

events.name: Women Techmakers St. Louis Launch

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Join us to celebrate the launch of the Women Techmakers group in St. Louis!  We’re really excited to bring this global initiative to St. Louis so that we can inspires more women to add their expertise and creativity to the tech community. We know that many of your employers have groups for women in the company, but we want you to meet all of the other awesome technical women in the area!

You’ll learn about Technigals Anonymous which will help you form your own personal board of directors.  You will also have the opportunity to help with the StL Techies Project.  Based on the Techies Project in Silicon Valley, the StL Techies Project aims to create a showcase of the diversity in tech in the area by interviewing people with unconventional paths to a career in technology. There are a variety of ways you can join the project including being interviewed yourself!

Women Techmakers events are designed to promote an environment of inclusivity for women in technology, as well as celebrate women leading the industry. We want to advance, grow, and celebrate women developers, designers, and technology entrepreneurs.

We hope to meet you there!

events.name: Women Techmakers: Salary Negotiations and Performance Reviews

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description: It's coming up on the end of the year so you know what time it is! It's hopefully time for a raise! Let's talk about how to prepare for a salary negotiation either for a yearly raise or for a new job. We can practice negotiation meetings with each other as well as amp each other up to write the best year-end performance review.

events.name: Hidden Figures!

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Come see Hidden Figures with Women Techmakers St. Louis! Everyone is welcome (you don't have to be part of Women Techmakers to come!). Tickets are $10 for adults.

You can buy tickets in one of two ways:
1. Contact me (Neem Serra) by either commenting here, direct message, or email ([masked]) to get a ticket from our reserved block. You can pay via Square cash ($neem) or Paypal ([masked]).
2. Purchase directly from the theater: https://www.amctheatres.com/movies/hidden-figures/showtimes/hidden-figures/2017-01-07/amc-esquire-7/all/51323506

Description of the movie: Three brilliant African-American women at NASA -- Katherine Johnson (Taraji P. Henson), Dorothy Vaughan (Octavia Spencer) and Mary Jackson (Janelle Monáe) -- serve as the brains behind one of the greatest operations in history: the launch of astronaut John Glenn (Glen Powell) into orbit, a stunning achievement that restored the nation's confidence, turned around the Space Race and galvanized the world.

events.name: Android Zombies: How to Not Get Bit

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Emmett Wilson of Asynchrony will lead the January talk, on Android.

We'll hear about application death and recreation. Learn resolution strategies and patterns to avoid issues, and ways to test these scenarios.

Doors at 6:00 pm, talk at 6:15.

We'll have pizzas and sodas; if people want we can head down to Flying Saucer for beers afterward.
events.how_to_find_us: Come to the door facing Spruce street. It'll be locked, but we'll have a phone number taped to the door to call.

events.name: Celebrate International Women's Day!

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Come celebrate International Women's Day* with us by hearing the stories of women in tech in the St. Louis area!

You'll get a chance to hear lightening talks by amazing women about their journey to get to where they are now. We will be officially launching the St. Louis Techies Project so you can go home and read the stories of dozens of more women in tech in St. Louis after the event.

This event is open to everyone so bring your kids, your significant others, your friends and your frenemies, and your neighbors. We have an inspiring lineup for you of all local women. There's no better way to support your local women in tech community than by getting to know them and celebrate their successes!

Light food and drinks will be provided as well as some fun swag. Sponsorship opportunities available. We will be in the Havanna room in the CIC.

*March 8th is technically International Women's Day, but I like celebrating the entire month/year.

events.name: Sensor & Music Player Hack Night

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Let’s do some Android hacking! We’ll collaboratively build a music player that integrates device sensors and teaches some RxJava concepts. When we’re done we’ll have an app that plays music — but only when you’re dancing. 

Bring your laptop and an Android device!

Doors 6:00 PM, program begins 6:30.  Plan for ~2 hours.
events.how_to_find_us: On Spruce just west of the Ballpark (same building as Flying Saucer).  If you park in the city garage that's adjacent to the west, (Cupples Garage) gates are open and you don't need to pull a ticket after 6pm. Use the Spruce door.

events.name: I/O recap & Offline Architecture for Android

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Hey everyone!

We had a brief hiatus around I/O, so let's gather around and discuss cool stuff from I/O.  Did you pick anything up that has already helped you in your work?  Share it with the group!

360AnDev is also happening that week in Denver. Can't make it? We'll be doing a preview talk of one of the sessions.

Android Architecture For The Subway

There’s something satisfying about seeing people on the subway use your app, and it’s not just the usual warm fuzzies — it’s seeing that people are able to get value out of it while offline.

In the New York Times Crosswords game for Android, we’ve made some decisions to make sure that even if your very first time opening the app is offline, you’ll still be able to have some fun. We’ll share some ideas to help you out with making your own apps work great offline too.

Doors open at 6PM
Program begins at 6:30

If we have some fun discussion, we can continue over beers down below at Flying Saucer afterward.

events.name: Conference Speaking: Hear Me Roar (Women Techmakers)

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Have you ever wanted to do a conference talk? Do you want to hear some techniques to get over your fears of public speaking? Do you want some feedback on your conference proposals? Or are you looking for some help brainstorming your next talk? Let's have a low-key chat about conference speaking, and help build each other up to have everyone hear us roar. Even if you're not sure about conference speaking, please come and hang out and be inspired.

**This is a welcoming and safer space for all folks who identify as women, transsexual, transgender, gender-variant, and genderqueer.

events.name: Holiday Happiness!

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Fancy food by Chef Matt Wynn. Bottled beverages to make you bubbly. Cupcakes and cookies by The Cup. Are you hungry yet?

Join us to celebrate the holidays and socialize with your favorite people in tech. When we're all on a sugar high, we will celebrate our successes from 2017. While we're at it, let's come up with our big plans for 2018. Do you want to learn something new? Do you want to make St. Louis a better place? Let's inspire each other and make it happen. We have the power to change the world.

We're going to raffle off two Chromecasts and two Google Home Minis so you can start your new year off right. Come join us for a fun night of socialization!

This event is co-hosted by the Google Developer Group and Women Techmakers St. Louis. Everyone is welcome to attend! Parking is available on the street or in many of the Clayton parking lots close by. Take the elevator to the 8th floor and enter the Slalom office.

events.name: 9th Annual St. Louis Area Tech Group Bowling Extravaganza!

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
IT'S THAT TIME OF YEAR AGAIN:  Join us and some of the other tech meetups in St Louis to bowl, chat, have some appetizers, and drinks. 

We've got the Moolah basement bowling alley to ourselves for three hours, for bowling, pool, and ping pong.  

The event is free and sponsored in part by Norton Staffing and some tech groups you know and love:

GDG St Louis, Vim Geeks, Southern Illinois Linux Users Group, and Papers We Love.

Meetup is bad at cross-listed/co-organized events, so please RSVP at the Eventbrite page below.  No need to worry about printing tickets or anything like that, this is strictly for a headcount.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/9th-annual-st-louis-area-tech-group-bowling-extravaganza-tickets-39066766751

See you there!

events.name: From a PHP Monolith, to Go Microservices, on Google Cloud Platform

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
**What**

We'll be hearing from JP Robinson (formerly of St. Louis), Principal Software Engineer at the New York Times. JP will be joining us remotely.

Here's more info about his talk:

Over the course of 2017, the API traffic of the New York Times crossword tripled. At the same time, a very small team of engineers managed to migrate its platform from a PHP monolith on Amazon Web Services to a suite of Go microservices on Google Cloud Platform. JP Robinson explains how his team was able to make the migration with zero downtime while cutting infrastructure costs in half.

**Who**

JP Robinson is a principal software engineer at the New York Times, where he has been using and evangelizing Go and microservices for over five years. When he’s not walking around the office beating the drum to lead coworkers toward serenity with Go and Google Cloud, he can be found lounging with his fat cat, enjoying the amazing food of NYC, or attempting (and failing) to get the high score on Joust at Barcade.

**Where**

Asynchrony Labs is graciously hosting us and providing food. Parking is available in the garage behind 1000 spruce street. There are parking toll booths, but the arms should be raised so you'll be able to enter and exit without paying. Take 9th St. south from Spruce (on the East side of the building.)

**When**

Doors open at 6pm, program begins at 6:30.
events.how_to_find_us: Watch this space for more info on parking & building access

events.name: International Women's Day Celebration!

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Broaden your horizons and celebrate women in the world at our International Women's Day celebration. We will start off the evening with a panel of local women who will share their career path and their successes. Following that, we will have activities centered around raising everyone up to be their best selves, and we will socialize with cupcakes! Hope to see you there!!

This event is open to everyone! Bring your favorite ally, your friend who is interested in tech, and anyone else who want to celebrate women.

events.name: Web as a First Class Citizen

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
**What**

Web development is no longer the no-mans-land in the Great Browser War. It has become a full fledged platform with increasingly more native support in OS's including Android, ChromeOS and even Windows. Join me to talk about the latest features of the web platform such as threading, the ability to run compiled code (think C, C++ or Rust in the browser) and fully offline capable Progressive Web Applications. This all culminates to a platform, where we can write one application that provides native experiences and performance across multiple OS's.

**Who**

Devin Kiser is a Software Engineer at WWT Asynchrony Labs where he's been in the beginnings of his career for the past 2 years. He spends his days on a project persistently trying to modernize and lighten a 15 year old Java thick-client application. He's been doing web development since High School (although web times were hard back then) for a total of 7 years, a multitude of projects, and has been drinking the web Kool-Aid all the while. For the most part he always has some or multiple projects in the works but, any free-time left is spent taking care of his 2 pups.

**Where**

Asynchrony Labs is graciously hosting us and providing food. Parking is available in the garage behind 1000 spruce street. There are parking toll booths, but the arms should be raised so you'll be able to enter and exit without paying. Take 9th St. south from Spruce (on the East side of the building.)

**When**

Doors open at 6pm, program begins at 6:30.
events.how_to_find_us: Parking is available in the garage behind 1000 spruce street. There are parking toll booths, but the arms should be raised so you'll be able to enter and exit without paying. Someone will be waiting in lobby to allow entrance to attendees.

events.name: Intro to Flutter *Hack Night*

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
**What**

Flutter is Google’s mobile UI framework for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source. We will be working through the flutter codelab and will finish with open ended discussion about the new framework. Bring your laptop and be prepared to roll up your sleeves and dive into some code.

**Where**

World Wide Technology is graciously hosting us and providing food. Watch the meetup for further info on location and building access.

**When**

Doors open at 6:00pm, program begins at 6:30.
events.how_to_find_us: We will be meeting at the 701 building. There will be signs directing you where to meet. We are in the Arsenal meeting room. Parking is free and on site.

events.name: Google I/O Extended

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Google announced what?! Join us for a recap of Google I/O — the big conference where Google announces all of their new technology and trends for the upcoming year. It will be a fun night of lightening talks to get you introduced to the latest and greatest of Google technologies. You’ll get a crash course in what you need to know from Google I/O. Agenda below!

We will raffle off a Google home mini for attendees. We will also plan our next year of events. Do you want to learn how to make an application for Google Home that will tell you when you need to leave home? Do you want to learn how to use Firebase for analytics and crash reporting? Do you want to amp your Android skills? Come help us help you!

Can’t wait to see you at #IOExtended!

Agenda:
Overview: Neem Serra
What's new in Android: Luke Steffen
Overview of Tensorflow/machine learning: Dan Corey
Firebase: Brett Lindsay
AR/VR: Jason Baird
Google Assistant: Alex Martellaro
Flutter: Erik Wolfe
Progressive Web Apps: Mark Katerberg
What's new in Gmail, Photos, and Maps: Chelsea Kaplan and Crystal Martin

events.name: WTM: Overcoming Imposter Syndrome: Presentation and Panel

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Women Techmakers and the Slalom Women's Leadership Network are excited to co-host this event on Imposter Syndrome! Join Allison Littman and Emily Gries as we explore what the Impostor Syndrome is, why many high-achieving and driven leaders suffer from it, and how you can beat it and embrace your success. The presentation will be followed by a panel discussion with some amazing women who share their experiences.

We look forward to an amazing evening with lively discussion and an opportunity to make new connections!

Panelists include:
· Sara Cima, Principal Director, Strategy, Accenture
· Denae Helvey, SVP, Anthem
· Leslie Nance, Consultant Manager, Slalom STL

**All gender identities welcome**

events.name: Machine Learning Study Jam

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Have you been hearing about Machine Learning but don't know anything about it? Google has a crash course on Machine Learning. Join us in our study jam where we will go through the first part of the course together!

---

Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC) is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective that will enable them to use machine learning within their everyday projects, and who wish to benefit from the power of TensorFlow wrapped in convenient higher-level abstractions.

This is a great opportunity for audience with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

events.name: Machine Learning Study Jam Part 2

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Join us for machine learning part two! We’ll start off where we left off, and we’ll actually have working internet this time (+ a backup plan) so that you can get some hands on experience with machine learning! We'll be able to show you some stuff with TensorFlow and get more in depth in the nitty gritty of machine learning. Pizza will be provided.

Course content here: https://developers.google.com/machine-learning/crash-course/

If you have any feedback from the previous machine learning event, please send us a message — we want to hear from you and constantly improve.

events.name: Cloud Next Extended (Intro to cloud and kubernetes)

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description: Join us as we go over the basics of everything cloud-related. We will go over what was new from the Google Cloud Next conference. We'll follow it up with an intro to kubernetes code lab. Every attendee will receive a free code to QwikLabs for a month where you can get certifications in cloud, kubernetes, and machine learning. You can also learn about each of these topics in a facbilitated way and get badges along the way! Bring your laptop for our code labs!

events.name: The Nonlinear Path - Finding Passion and Purpose

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
It's never too late to find a career you love! Better yet, there are ways to retrain yourself without accumulating (more) debt or adding letters behind your name. You can go to work (almost) everyday, excited about what you do and loving your future.

Join us as Andie Hemmersmeier talks about her transition to tech. A School Psychologist by education, Andie found herself in a career that was less than ideal and not fulfilling in the way she'd hoped. Through taking a somewhat non-traditional path, she taught herself about design and the accompanying software and even learned a bit about coding along the way. Andie now works as an Experience Design Consultant where she is able to marry two of her passions - great design and psychology.

Slalom's Women's Leadership Network and Women Techmakers St. Louis are excited to have you join us for Andie's talk followed by a panel full of people with non-linear career paths that are ready to answer your questions and help you change careers!

events.name: Strong, Kind, and Broken in All the Best Ways

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Join Women Techmakers and the Slalom Women's Leadership Network for another great, inspiring talk! Megs Carter will be speaking on Strong, Kind, and Broken in All the Best Ways:
Using agile methods to take your life back.

**
Depression and anxiety have been a part of my life for nearly 2 decades, and with it came feelings of shame and self-condemnation. However, in my day-to-day existence of working with agile teams, I love their imperfections and remind my teams daily that they do not have to be perfect. If I can treat my agile delivery teams with compassion and understanding, why couldn’t I extend that to myself? Agile delivery isn’t just an IT process. It’s a way of bringing people together to tackle challenges and create change. By applying agile methods to myself, I’ve been able to improve my quality of life and focus on the areas that are most valuable to me. If you are someone interested in making a change in your life, this talk will hopefully inspire you.
**

Megs has worked with agile delivery teams for 5 years and believes that treating folks with compassion and respect is the key to kickass teams of ninja problem solvers. Always searching for practical solutions, she doesn’t buy into capital-A agile dogma. Instead she likes meet people where they are in order to solve real problems and create valuable change. Away from the office, she sings to her cats and does her best to embarrass her teenage daughter and husband in St Louis, MO.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Come learn flutter with us with Erik Wolfe! You might remember him from that super engaging talk on flutter at our Google I/O Extended. You asked and we listened and here he is again!

Flutter is a language that allows you to do hybrid development for iOS and Android. We will go over the basics and start you on the path to learn how to make your own app in flutter!

----

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

events.name: Holiday Party!

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description: Join us for a holiday party cohosted by the Slalom Women's Leadership Network, Women Techmakers St. Louis, and the Google Developer Group! We'll have snacks, raffles, presents, and a professional photographer to do headshots for everyone! More details to come soon!
events.how_to_find_us: If you get here before 6, please take the elevator to the 8th floor.  After 6, there should either be someone at the front doors to guide you or a phone number to text.

events.name: DevFest

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description:
Join us for our very first DevFest! We are hosting a 4-track conference -- one community track, two general tech tracks, and one Angular track. Details can be seen here for the schedule: https://stldevfest.com/schedule/

This is a ticketed event - please buy tickets at https://devfest-stl-2019.eventbrite.com. Send me a message if you want to volunteer or need help with ticket costs. Every attendee will get breakfast, lunch, and a t-shirt!

Super excited to see everyone there!!

events.name: Women's Day Celebration

group.name: GDG St Louis: Google Developers Group St Louis

events.description: Come celebrate International Women's Day as we explore the theme "Balance for Better." We will start off the evening with a series of short talks form local women sharing their experiences and journeys. Following that, we will have a paneled discussion with the speakers focusing on how we become our own advocates, encourage allies, and foster inclusion. We will conclude with time to socialize and eat some yummy food made by local women-owned businesses. Everyone is welcome! Bring an ally, best friend, mom, sister, brother or significant other--anyone who wants to celebrate women!
